label: Terms of Service
prompt:
Welcome to the HealthyLife health risk appraisal.
By continuing, you accept the terms of service.

q.label: Please read and agree to the following terms
q.prompt: The purpose of this exercise is for you to explore and learn about your health risks and of health risks faced by others in the population. Participation will take about 20 minutes. Taking part in this assessment is voluntary and you can choose not to participate. The only risk to you is that you might be uncomfortable answering some of the questions. Feel free to skip any question which makes you feel uncomfortable. Your answers will be maintained as confidential. Responses will not be associated with your personal information. If you have any questions about this exercise you can contact Dr. Lawrence K. Silbart at Lawrence.Silbart@uconn.edu

label: Terms of Service
prompt:
Welcome to the ChooseLife health risk appraisal.
By continuing, you accept the terms of service. This is a mini version of the full HRA which consists of a certain number of questions.

label: Basic Information
prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.label: Height
q.prompt: Without shoes, no fractions.

q.label: Weight
q.prompt: Without shoes, no fractions.

q.label: Diabetes
q.prompt: Have you ever been told that you have diabetes (or sugar diabetes)?

q.label: Stroke
q.prompt: Have you ever been told that you had a stroke?

q.label: Heart Attack
q.prompt: Have you ever been told that you had a heart attack?

q.label: Heart Disease
q.prompt: Have you ever been told that you have heart disease?

label: Blood Pressure
prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.label: Blood Pressure Medication
q.prompt: Are you taking blood pressure medication?

q.label: Blood Pressure
q.prompt: What is your blood pressure now?  If you don't know, estimate below in the next question.

q.label: Estimate Blood Pressure
q.prompt: If you do not know the numbers, choose the option that describes your blood pressure.

q.label: Cholesterol Medication
q.prompt: During the past month have you taken any medication for cholesterol?

q.label: Cholesterol Check
q.prompt: Have you had your cholesterol checked in the last five years?

q.label: Cholesterol Level
q.prompt: What is your total cholesterol level (based on a blood test)? Leave it blank if you don't remember.

q.label: HDL Cholesterol
q.prompt: What is your HDL cholesterol level (based on a blood test)? Leave it blank if you don't remember.

q.label: Estimate Cholesterol Level
q.prompt: A physician told me that my total cholesterol was:

q.label: Estimate HDL Cholesterol
q.prompt: A physician told me that my HDL (good) cholesterol was:

q.label: Blood sugar
q.prompt: What is the result of your most recent blood sugar test (non-fasting blood glucose)?

q.label: Triglycerides
q.prompt: What is your most recent triglycerides level?

label: Diabetes
prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.label: Diabetes control (HbA1C)
q.prompt: Have you had a hemoglobin A1C test this year?

q.label: Hemoglobin A1C Level
q.prompt: What is the result of your most hemoglobin A1C test?

label: Smoking
prompt: Please answer the following questions

q.label: Smoking
q.prompt: How would you describe your smoking habits?

q.label: Used to Smoke
q.prompt: What was the average number per day that you smoked in the 2 years before you quit?

q.label: Years since quitting
q.prompt: How many years has it been since you quit smoking?

q.label: Still Smoke
q.prompt: How many cigarettes a day do you smoke?

q.label: Daily cigars
q.prompt: How many cigars do you usually smoke per day?

q.label: Daily pipes
q.prompt: How many pipes of tobacco do you usually smoke per day?

q.label: Daily Shisha
q.prompt: How many times do you smoke shisha per day?

q.label: Daily Shisha
q.prompt: How many times do you smoke shisha per day?

q.label: Smokeless tobacco
q.prompt: How many times per day do you use smokeless tobacco? (Chewing tobacco, snuff, pouches, etc.)

q.label: Vaping
q.prompt: Have you ever used an electronic vapor product?

q.label: Vaping Frequency
q.prompt: During the past 30 days, on how many days did you use an electronic vapor product?

label: Driving
prompt: Please answer the following questions

q.label: Travel Method
q.prompt: On a typical day, how do you usually travel?

q.label: Safety Belt Usage
q.prompt: What percent of the time do you usually buckle your safety belt when driving or riding?

q.label: Distracted Driving
q.prompt: Do you frequently text, e-mail or use a cell phone while driving a car or other vehicle?

q.label: Driving Speed
q.prompt: On average, how close to the speed limit do you usually drive?

q.label: Drinking and Driving
q.prompt: How many times in the last month did you drive or ride when the driver had perhaps too much alcohol to drink?

q.label: Weekly Alcohol Drinking
q.prompt: How many drinks of an alcoholic beverage do you have in a typical week? (Write the number of each type of drink)

q.label: Binge Drinking
q.prompt: In the last month have you had 5 or more drinks in a row?

q.label: DUI
q.prompt: Have you ever been arrested for driving under the influence or driving while intoxicated?

q.label: Commercial Driver
q.prompt: Are you currently a commercial or professional driver?

label: Gender Specific
prompt: Please Answer the Following Questions

q.label: First Menstrual Period Age
q.prompt: At what age did you have your first menstrual period?

q.label: Age of Bearing First Child
q.prompt: How old were you when your first child was born? (If no children, write 0)

q.label: Last Mammogram
q.prompt: How long has it been since your last breast x-ray (mammogram)?

q.label: Family Breast Cancer History
q.prompt: How many women in your natural family (mother and sisters only) have had breast cancer?

q.label: Hysterectomy
q.prompt: Have you had a hysterectomy operation?

q.label: Pap Smear Test
q.prompt: How long has it been since you had a pap test and/or pelvic exam?

q.label: Colon Cancer Screening
q.prompt: About how long has it been since you had a colorectal cancer screening?

q.label: Prostate Cancer Screening
q.prompt: Have you talked to your doctor about being screened for prostate cancer?

q.label: Relatives with cancer
q.prompt: Has one or more of your first degree relatives ever had any form of cancer?

q.label: Unprotected Sex
q.prompt: Have you engaged in unprotected sex with one or more partners of ‘unknown’ or ‘questionable’ STD status?

q.label: Street Drugs
q.prompt: Have you ever experimented or used recreational (or ‘street’) drugs beyond marijuana?

label: Prevention
prompt: Please Answer the Following Questions

q.label: Annual Checkup
q.prompt: Do you have annual check-ups?

q.label: Annual Flu Shot
q.prompt: Do you get an annual flu shot?

q.label: Teeth Cleaned
q.prompt: Do you have your teeth cleaned at least twice per year?

q.label: Eye Exam
q.prompt: Have you had your eyes examined within the last three years?

q.label: HIV Test
q.prompt: Have you been tested for HIV?

q.label: Declined Vaccine
q.prompt: Have you ever declined a vaccine (or have your parents declined one on your behalf)?

q.label: HPV Vaccine
q.prompt: Have you received the HPV vaccine?

q.label: Severe Sunburn
q.prompt: Have you had more than one severe sunburn (skin peals) or used a tanning bed within the last year?

label: Chronic Conditions
prompt: Do you have any of the following conditions?

q.label: Fast Food
q.prompt: How many times a week did you eat fast food meals or snacks?

q.label: Fruit
q.prompt: How many servings of fruit did you eat each day?

q.label: Vegetables
q.prompt: How many servings of vegetables did you eat each day?

q.label: Soft Drinks
q.prompt: How many regular sodas, energy drinks or glasses of sweet tea did you drink each day?

q.label: High Protein Foods
q.prompt: How many times a week did you eat beans (like brown or white beans), chicken or fish?

q.label: Junk Food
q.prompt: How many times a week did you eat chips, cookies, crackers or other unhealthy snacks (high salt or high fat)?

q.label: Sugar-Sweetened Beverage
q.prompt: Do you drink more than two sugar-sweetened beverages per week?

q.label: Caffeine
q.prompt: Do you consume more than two doses of caffeine per day (in soft drinks, coffee, chocolate or other products)?
I add sugar, jams, honey, syrup or other sweeteners to food or drinks.
I eat one of more servings of sweetened desserts, candy, granola bars or cereals.
How many meals per day do you eat?
How many times do you snack per day?
In the past 7 days my sleep quality was

I had a problem with my sleep

During the past 7 days, how much have you been bothered by stomach or bowel problems?

During the past 7 days, how much have you been bothered by pain in your arms, legs or joints?
During the past 7 days, how much have you been bothered by headaches?
During the past month have you taken any medication for arthritis?
During the past month have you taken any medication for asthma?
During the past month have you taken any medication for cholesterol?

q.label: Your bodies anatomy and physiology or its form and function.

label: Cough and Hand Hygiene
prompt: Everyone can use a straightforward approach to protect themselves and their families from infectious diseases that are spread through contact with droplets containing pathogens (harmful viruses and bacteria).

q.prompt: How many times have you washed your hands today?
Do you have a cough?
Do you have a fever (a fever is a higher than normal body temperature taken with an accurate thermometer)?
Are you having new or increased shortness of breath?
Do work or other activities require you to interact with other people in person?

prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.prompt: What exercise program are you doing now?
On a scale of 1-10 (with 10 being the greatest) how serious are you about accomplishing your fitness goals?
Do you wear a tracker of any type?
What time of day do you prefer to workout?
Have you used a barbell before?
Describe Your Job
How many glasses of water to you drink per day?

Do you know how many calories you eat per day?

How often do you eat out?
Do you enjoy cooking?
Would you be open to seeing our nutritionist if your insurance would cover it?

prompt: Select below your goals

q.prompt: Lose Weight
Gain Muscle
Improve Overall Health
Shape and Tone

label: Engagement & Follow Up
prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.prompt: Does your company have a current corporate wellness programme?
Is it a sustainable programme that gives your company annual reports on the health progress of your staff?

Would you like to have an online programme that can reach and empower your staff through Individualized Health Solutions, Fitness Tracking, Personalized Meal Plans, Community Support, Mental & Behavioural Health Support, Rewards, and Verifiable Progress Reports

label: Resolutions & Beyond Questions
prompt: Please answer the following questions.

q.prompt: If offered, how likely are you to participate in an onsite fitness program offered at your work location?
Are you motivated by working out in a group or alone?
If offered, how interested would you be in learning new techniques for managing stress and creating work-life balance?
When you seek medical treatment, do you typically seek conventional treatments (medical doctor) or alternative therapies (chiropractic care)?
On a scale of 1-10, how helpful would a weight loss/management structured program and wellness coach be to helping you reach your goals? 1=not helpful at all 10 very helpful
How likely would you be to participate in one on one health coaching with a certified professional to help you achieve specific health outcomes?
If offered, how likely would you be interested in  participating in wellness workshops specific to certain concerns such as diabetes, heart health,  tobacco cessation, etc.
If offered, how likely would you be willing to participate in programs offered at work to help you take control of your health (such as exercise, stress management, nutrition, etc).
If programs above were offered by your employer, how likely would you be willing to share in the cost of these programs?

values.label: Would be willing to share only if I sign up but do not complete participation

q.prompt: On a scale from 1-5 (5 being most important), how important is it for you to lead by example and pass on good healthy habits to your family and friends.

prompt: During the past 6 months, has your health had an impact on your performance at (select at that apply):

q.prompt: Home
Office
Social Event with friends/family

label: Mental Health
prompt: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

q.prompt: Little interest or pleasure in doing things.
Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless.
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much.
Feeling tired or having little energy.
Poor appetite or overeating.
Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down.
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television.
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or the opposite, being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual.
Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or of hurting yourself.
Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge.
Not being able to stop or control worrying.
Worrying too much about different things.
Trouble relaxing.
Being so restless that it is hard to sit still.
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable.
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen.
